alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 6:29PM PDT until August 21 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: The National Weather Service in Los Angeles/Oxnard has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Los Angeles County in southwestern California... * Until 300 AM PDT Monday. * At 629 PM PDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring, a DANGEROUS FLOODING situation continues to develop. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Thousand Oaks, Malibu, Lake Los Angeles, Acton, Wrightwood, Burbank, Palmdale, Mount Wilson, Pasadena, North Hollywood, Griffith Park, Santa Clarita, Universal City, Van Nuys, Lancaster, Hollywood, Alhambra, Northridge, Downtown Los Angeles and Beverly Hills. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
